name: Kevi B
text: I really wanted to give this restaurant a 5 Star, but the pace of service knocked one star off.  Our waitress was very nice and tried her best to accommodate the large number of tables in her area.  The food was delicious!  We were given ‚Ä¶More

name: Fred Roeder
text:
Delicious French Dip sandwich with TONS of roast beast!!!
Very attentive server also.
Overall excellent experience.

name: Steven Miller
text: Sports bar for the pizza fan. The best pizza and all around good food in town.

name: Brett Larson
text: Always enjoy Boston's! They have an impressive menu, and the food and drinks are very good. All their dishes are great but I'm a big fan of their pizzas and burgers.

name: Steven Miller
text: Best pizza and salad in town. The bar omg the liquor out of this world. The staff are friendly as well.

name: Steve Giuricich
text: 1st time there...staff was busy but efficent... food was great

name: Jamaal Gilbert
text: I love their  chickens  is bangs pizza is awesome  also

name: Pandora Boee
text: Solid place to get together with friends, watch the game, and have good pub food. I liked the thai bites.

name: Craig Salmons
text: Casual atmosphere where the food is always good...burgers, pizzas, and munchies.

name: Jabari Ester
text: The place was nice, the workers was nice also. The food was amazing I would recommend this business.

name: Eric&Ciera Garland
text: Food and service was AMAZING. Only giving 3 stars due to the fact that there was a baby cockroach in our silverware napkin.

name: Jim Fraze
text: This is a good place. We went on a Friday that the Blue Jackets didn't play. It was still busy, but not packed. The service was alright, and the food was really good. If you're into Artisan pizza, you'll enjoy it.

name: Jesse Meerbott
text: The food was good. The atmosphere in here is very family friendly, the server did not seem to be the most experienced but he was still great anything he could not answer he got the answer to. We tried the pizza, wings, my family had the ‚Ä¶More

name: Sheena I
text: I just live their brownie...but I asked for double scoop ice cream and brought my own walnuts

name: Matt
text:
Good food
Great atmosphere!

name: John D
text: Service was good,  but the food was okay.

name: David Merrick
text: Great atmosphere! It's an interesting mix of sports bar and street facing cafe. I was there for lunch and it wasn't too loud like the typical sports bar. Meanwhile, the good was excellent. I had the lunch special; personal signature pizza ‚Ä¶More

name: Craig Reveal
text:
Incredible place.
We were running a little late to a Blue Jackets game.
It was 21 minutes from sitting down to done and leaving.
On top of that, the food was Phenomenal!

name: Warren Fitzpatrick
text: All food was good. Wife's drink was a bit strong. Food came out fast

name: Miosotys Nunez
text: This place has a family vibe with a sports bar feel. I didn't get pizza, although you can get some here and also design your own. I only wanted wings and these were great. There was no breading. Good sauce/rub offering.

name: Veronica Allshouse
text: If you love sports this is the restaurant for you. From hockey to baseball and every sport inbetween. The staff is nice and treats you like family. The food is reasonably priced and the atmosphere is energized. I recommend this restaurant for anyone who is visiting Columbus, Ohio.

name: Tessa Short
text: This place was pretty good. I got the Hawaiian pizza and it was great. The prices aren't terrible for downtown Columbus. It was around $10 for an 8inch pizza. So I guess that's average. But it was pretty good. I'd eat here again sometime.

name: William Egan
text: From out of town, so only are here once. Was there for a concert at the next door arena. Good food and ok service. They could have staffed one or two extra servers considering the big event going on that night.

name: Kollin Rice
text: Nice clean modern facility. Looks like a sports bar. Feels like a sports bar. Has TV's like a sports bar. On a Monday night ONE tv is tuned to Monday night football and there are 7 people in the place who don't work there. I imagine it's ‚Ä¶More

name: Clinton Parsons Jr
text: Stopped in while teens going to concert.  Large clean restaurant with angles to see  multiple tvs.  Sporting events everywhere and easy to see.  Bartenders were friendly, attentive and helpful with menu.  I had the plant based burger and it ‚Ä¶More

name: Ashley's Brainy Centers
text: We stopped in after a twenty one pilots concert. We both ordered a drink which was pretty good. My husband ordered a six cut pizza expecting we could both share it. It came and it was basically a personal pizza. It was tasty but very small. It fit on a plate. Everything was overall pretty good though.

name: T L
text:
I. Love. This. Place.
Eat here ‚ù§

name: hogmark1
text: Great sports bar. Family friendly. Awesome pizzas. Make your own. Have fun.

name: Keith Ankrom
text: Fast friendly service . Great menu. Even though a pizza place, they have great sandwiches like the pulled pork sandwich I had.  Great bar selection as well.  Well stocked bourbon shelf.

name: Jeff Imes
text: Very, very crowded prior to CBJ game, which is expected, though they did well to keep the customer turnover moving.  That said, they should really consider limiting their menu to quick order items only when it's ultra busy like that.

name: Nathan Davisson
text: Good place to eat before a hockey game. Food is awesome and reasonable price as well.

name: John Mowery
text: We had heather as our server on a very busy fridsy/Disney on ice. Service was outstanding. Thank you.

name: Terry Sneary
text: Got an outside table to have a few beers and people watch. Good food. Staff was very friendly. We'll definitely be back.

name: Jackson Henry
text: After a disappointing trip to Cleveland, this restaurant was the highlight of our trip. Excellent pizza, delicious sliders (especially the pulled pork), good fries, and a fun atmosphere.

name: Angelo Serra
text: Good place for a quick bite or beverage before an event at Nationwide or ExpressLive.  TVs abound so if you want to hang out to watch a couple of sporting events simultaneously you can.

name: Timothy Ager
text: This is supposed to be a sports bar but I had to ask them to put the sound on for game 4 of the NBA finals. It's probably better to go right after work if you walk. I met 7 people out and we all parked in different spots ranging from $2-$8. So prepare for that in before you go here if you drive.

name: Shirley Mertz
text: Always good. Service good. Pizzas great

name: Holly Shaw
text: Ordered a chicken pizza that tasted like I was eating wings?? Cant for the life of me remember what it was called but OH MY GOD üòç was the best tasting thing I've ever eaten, especially after it was dipped in ranch dressing....my new love. Place was super empty when I went and waitress was lovely.

name: Steve Copits
text: Great food and drink. Love to watch my CBJ there!

name: Greg Brooks
text: Best place to "Pre-game" in the Arena District! Service is always great, the beer is always cold, and the pizza is perfect before an event.

name: Anne Laux
text: Basically a TGI Friday's. Service was good, but was was just ok. Many other options in the area and local options as well.

name: maxwell posival
text: Bostons: Great bar to go to before a Blue Jackets game. This place can be packed, so keep that in mind. This is also a good place to go to if you are working in the Arena District and need someplace to go for lunch.

name: Jacqueline Maldonado
text: Good place for lunch,  in and out in an hour.  Depending in the servers personalities, it could be hot or miss with service. Good food.

name: Josh Uminski
text: Always my "go to" spot before Clippers games. Food is always good, sometimes great, but never bad. Can occasionally be pretty crowded, and have some waits. Heads up....draft beers are huge!

name: Jeff O'Neal
text: Really enjoyed the food and the service we received.   I will go back soon.

name: Shannon Beason
text: Great dinner before seeing Teddy Swims! Food was AWESOME!!

name: Jhontae Hughes
text: Located right across from Nationwide arena...the pizza is good, and the flat bread is excellent. This is a good place to bring your fam to grab a bite before the Blue Jackets game.

name: Elly Smith
text: Great service!

name: Kelli Stiles
text: Go there before every Blue Jackets game I get to attend. Never disappoints!

name: Tennessee Smith
text: Just sat at the bar. Prices were fair with a nice bourbon selection. Staff was quick & friendly!

name: lindsay rowland
text: Had to go to rush to eat so I could make it to a concert. Staff was quick and helpful. Made it to the concert with time to spare. Good food too.

name: Michael Kubica
text: Bostons is a middle of the road type of place. The taps aren't amazing and the food is subpar. Last time I had the chicken parm and it was on par with a low grade microwave meal. However, the service is good, and they work well with groups.

name: John Carson Jr.
text: Good food nice atmosphere

name: Ryan Brofford
text: Rude manager.  Was in waiting list forever so ordered food to go. Waited at least an hour. When a table opened up.  Asked hostess if we could sit there and was told yes.  She even cleared it for us and brought our food to us.  Then manager ‚Ä¶More

name: Michael Wancheck
text: Get here early before games. Great food and service

name: alli arnold
text: Awesome food, huge portions

name: Monica Payne
text: Dinner before a hockey game. Very busy, but good service and food.

name: Luke Harvey
text: Service is very slow but the food is amazing

name: Victoria Cornell
text: Polite, reasonably quick service. Menu has a little of everything- delicious appetizers, pasta, burgers, pizza, salads.

name: Bob S
text: This might be the best pizza in Columbus, and I'm a pizza snob for sure. We also ordered wings, they were very good. We were seated right away just after leaving the Amy Grant concert on 12/15/17. The food arrived  quicker than expected. ‚Ä¶More

name: Satish Kumar
text: Very near to the arena. Ambience is good.. Sandwiches were well made.. The restaurant was well maintained too.

name: Slade The Expectation
text: Great food and great atmosphere üëå

name: Angie S
text: Pizza was mediocre. Service was great and atmosphere was fun.

name: Larissa Raposo
text: Love it! The pizza is amazing, the staff is very friendly and the beer is cold! Everything I expect from a bar.

name: Stormy Doctor
text: Best pizza I've had in a really long time. possibly best ever.

name: Maurica Waugaman
text: First time stopping in here. Food was good beer was cold! Staff very friendly!

name: Jennifer Schaffer
text: We had a great time here. It was a really slow night so we definitely felt like we were valued by all the staff. The food was delicious and served quick and hot. I can't wait to come back.

name: D.J. Byrnes
text: Wide ranging menu of delicious food, ample choices of alcohol and a friendly staff to go with great prices and a swath of televisions. What else could you need?

name: Steven Shaw
text: They may be from our beloved Canada, but these folks are what other competitors want to be..

name: Megan Ridge
text: The older gentleman working as the host is extremely rude. I'm sitting at the bar and have heard/seen him be rude to multiple people and customers walking in. I understand there is a rally going on in the park across the street but that is absolutely no reason for him to be rude and disrespectful to patrons.

name: Steve Reese
text: 2nd time there. Got the mega meats burger. Burger was extremely bland with no taste in it at all. The only thing that somewhat save the sandwich was the rest of it. Pizza sauce, sala.i, pepperoni and cheese. Came with fries, which h were good, but not very many on the plate. Less than a McDonalds small order. E tremely disappointed.

name: Quinn Stewart
text: We had a really nice and friendly waitress before the Slayer concert

name: rick salazar
text: Very friendly place. Bartenders and hosts were excellent!

name: Stephen Smith
text: Came here before a clippers game for lunch. The restaurant was busy. I was surprised at how quick the service was. We were still able to get in and out. The waitress was friendly and the food was good. I will go back.

name: Lucas Koehler
text: We had a big party go before a clippers game and the Food and service was wonderful. Highly recommend for a before game meal, and it's within walking distance to the field.

name: Floyd Morris
text: Service is good and fast. It's a great option for lunch if you're in a rush. Food was fresh and tasty.

name: Anna Overman
text: Service was just a little slow, but the food was delicious. We sat on the patio... Great for people watching! The host was kind enough to send us under an awning in case it rained. The mushroom flat bread was outstanding! Crisp crust with great flavor.

name: Noah Dean
text: Cheers to big beers and great service!

name: Nicholas Wortman
text: The buttered pizza crust is incredible. Plus the lunch pizza combo is a great deal.

name: Eli Olvera
text: Excellent food and drinks atmosphere was pleasant

name: norman hartley
text: Nice lied back.friendy staff good happy hour and pizzia

name: Ishara Guruge
text: The Thai bites and the spinach dip were good and I love their pizza crust. Service was a little slow but good experience around

name: Kath Field
text: Great food, very nice waitress and we were able to reserve our table which really helped us since we are attending a large conference at the arena.

name: Sara Calvey
text: I stopped by off of a whim and the service was great. Would recommend for anyone in the area, decently priced drinks and food. Great service

name: Jodi Helms
text: Always great food and friendly staff even on busy game nights

name: CAM
text: Cold beer. Great view for watching sports on TV. They have an outside patio, which is perfect for summertime.

name: John Kennedy
text: Excellent food,prices,staff

name: Leslie
text: Walking distance from our hotel, and worth the walk!  The pizza was fantastic and the wings were pretty good (we like our wings super hot and these were warm but tasty).  Our server was great and we were very happy!

name: Jesse Henry
text: The food and drinks are good. While I appreciate there being outside seating, the tables are quite close together.

name: Michael Finnegan
text: Good after game hang out.

name: Suzannah Crowder
text: We stopped by last night after the Jackets game and had so much fun! The service was excellent (I didn't catch our server's name but she was young with blonde hair and glasses) and the crowd there was fun too. We'll be back üòÄ

name: Abbey Budin
text: This place had really good food. I ordered white russians and they weren't the best, very watered down with extra cream in a full sized glass instead of the small glasses that white russians usually come in. The waitress was really nice, ‚Ä¶More

name: C S
text: I come to Boston's frequently for lunch as I work in the area. I was taking family to the concert last evening and I was excited to show them my "local" spot. Unfortunately the service we experienced was atrocious. We arrived at the ‚Ä¶More

name: Jose Diaz
text: Great place. Great food. Really good service

name: Gary Stehly
text: Food hood... especially the spinach artichoke dip! Only issue was my sald came after main course.

name: Mella Curtis
text: The manager kept our "Stanley Cup" and our "Sweep the Lightning" broom for us while we went to the game. Really appreciated that. We will go there every chance we get.

name: Christine Berger
text: Food is always good. Diverse menu. Fun place.

name: Brian Jarrell
text: The atmosphere was great. Our waitress was attentive the food was great.  I suggest the Hawaiian pizza.  It was awesome.

name: David McClellan
text: Boston's is a great place to have a few drinks and watch the game. There's plenty of TVs, so it's easy to keep an eye on all the games if you're there on a football Saturday. The food is pretty good, better than (although different from) a ‚Ä¶More

name: Vic Gonzales
text: Good food and service

name: Daniel Volkmann
text: The straws were too short but the food was great and the staff was even better.

name: Patience Bogart
text: Great place to eat and fast friendly service

name: Andrea Hawkins
text: Great environment! Fast easy seating, viewing great for Arena District activity watching. Family oriented, great for family nights, fantastic hosts and hostess. The food is always superb. We think our children can eat this every night for dinner.

name: Jason Ronis
text: Great wings. Good service. Fair price. Great for a quick lunch.

name: Jason Mrugacz
text: Cool place to hit up for a couple beverages and a bite before you head over to Nationwide.

name: dalene middlekauff
text: Great late night eats after the TOP concert!

name: Samrat Sen
text: Nice food love the service !!

name: David A.
text: Place gets packed before shows or events but that's cause the beer is cheap and the food is great. You'll be pleasantly surprised if you can get seated during rush hour.

name: Joe Krannich
text: Real pizza. Right amount of salt taste on the crust.

name: Rahim
text: Food was good but service was horrible.

name: Tony Holland
text: Great variety. Food tastes great and great service. Definitely on my list to go again

name: Dave Johnson
text: Hawian bbq pizza was great.

name: Jerry Hagan
text: Chicken Cobb Salad was excellent!

name: Jason Cross
text: Pizza pretty good as was service

name: Ricko Craig
text: First time there ordered pizza for take out pizza was good and the people were friendly

name: Catherine Hrabak
text: Boston's is great. We usually get seated quickly, food is always delicious, and servers are friendly and around just enough. One of my favorite places. :)

name: MsTeeT J
text: Love the pizza and wings

name: John Schnell
text: Good food and service

name: t p
text: Great food, and friendly service

name: brianne blake
text: I visited Bostons for a happy hour for work and it was a great time. The waitress was great even though it was super busy and the quality of the food was good too. I would recommend.

name: Jimi Stephens
text: Pretty upset. We came in at 3pm on a Friday. Got sat by a nice gentleman and that was about it. We sat in our seat for around 15-20 mins waiting on a server and no one came; even noticed a young woman get sat and served after we had arrived ‚Ä¶More

name: Mel S
text: Fast service even during wall to wall people times.  Decent drink prices.

name: Alexis Kubina
text: Had the Margherita flatbread and it was awesome! Very friendly staff and management!

name: Joey Keenan
text: Our food was excellent and the waitress waa very friendly! Once the pregame crowd for the Blue Jackets games leaves, it is a nice place to be at.

name: Brenda Fairbanks
text: Ok for a bite before blue jackets hockey game way to crowed though

name: Buffy Oldaker
text: Great service, fantastic food and fun atmosphere

name: Paul Whittaker
text: Great pizza. Service is great and just a good place to be

name: BRENT Shipley
text: Love this place. Extremely friendly. Pizza has tons of flavor.  We try and get here often!

name: Annamarie McGee
text: I had the Nooner lunch special with the BBQ ckn pizza, crust is amazing... Delicious !!

name: Nick Johnson
text: We go here a lot before Clippers games.  Affordable and good food!

name: Regina Damopoulos
text: Good place to meet friends and family

name: Emily Huang
text: Service was great. Selection of food is abundant. My veggie burger was finely made. It is quite crowded though.

name: Al Vassey
text: This was a gem. We had never been before. We had pizza and wings. Our daughter and husband got something else. They live in Columbus and we're up from South Carolina visiting. Since then, they have been back several times. When we're in town again we will definitely stop. Worth it!

name: Roslen Tejeda
text: The service and the food were awesome!

name: Judy Davis
text: Great food and service

name: Todd Newberry
text: Ordered the peppers and pickles app, no zing to the peppers. Ordered burgers and lasagna for entrees. Lasagna was meh. Burger was ok. Probably not a repeat, too many other choices that rock close by. Wait staff was very friendly and good. They should get a five.

name: FOC
text: Out of date menu. States the burger comes with seasoned fries. We get unseasoned fries that don't even have salt on them. When we asked they said "oh we used to have seasoned fries but we stopped selling them 2 months ago. It's just salt on them now". When we replied but these don't even have salt we got a blank stare.

name: Matt Albright
text: Great place.   Fast and courteous service.    Very accommodating a group of 30   thanks for being there for the Cleveland Jr. Lumberjacks hockey team.

name: Pawankishore Reddy
text: Its good restaurant.  I like the food very much . The staff is curtious and ambience is nice. During rush hours it takes time to be seated.

name: Vince Arnold
text: Excellent service and quality food at a reasonable price

name: Brian Roush
text: Not impressed at all with our visit. We thought this would be a cool sports bar at which to hang out. Unfortunately pretty much everything was mediocre and overpriced. Our waitress was slow and not quite friendly. My wife got chicken ‚Ä¶More

name: kevin leo
text: Always have good beer on tap love the pizza love the wings

name: Mike Shaw
text: Great food! Had the BBQ pork sandwich

name: Kevin Beyerbach
text: It was just a typical chain sports bar, waitress didnt know much about the menu or what actually was a good item for first time guest..

name: Marc Honrath
text: Decent food. Great service. Good place to go after a CBJ game.

name: Beth Santore
text: Very accommodating for large groups - we made a reservation for 25 people for my team at work for a going away lunch.  We were worried when 10 additional people wanted to come, but when we called the night before, they said it was no problem.  Very friendly staff, QUICK service, and great food.  It's always a pleasure to go here.

name: Leila Rho
text: Stopped in for the first time to have some lunch, the food was pretty good and the staff was friendly.

name: John Noss II
text: They were able to accommodate our large group right away, we ordered two large pizzas, and then realized we are pressed for time. They were very accommodating, allowed us to pay at the bar, and made us feel like it was no trouble at all. Food was also very good, pizza especially. Outstanding!!

name: Matthew Meade
text: We enjoyed our server Addy! She got brought us our pasta and the pasta was delicious along with the delicious breadsticks and great Pepsi!

name: Stephen Haines
text: Pizza and burgers are great here. Great place to come on lunch break, just gets really busy around noon on weekdays

name: Ryan Sears
text: Great deal on the nooner, waiter was very personable and fun during March madness

name: Shelly Morgan
text: Best service and restaurant ever. Just saying,, Alex did an awesome job.. Thanks Boston for hiring great people and staff..

name: Melissa Furrow
text: Food and service was great

name: Tom Marlow
text: Awesome food and service.

name: Rich Miller
text: Nice place, great service, very friendly!

name: Lawrence Todd
text: Very crowded but good food and good service.

name: Drew W
text: Drinks were priced well and tasted good. Service was quick and friendly.

name: Steven Miller
text: It has the feeling of the TV series but somehow I miss Norm walking in lol. The atmsophere is very nice and the setting marvelous this is across from the District Arena too. And the baseball stadium. I love it. Take in the seens as well. Plenty of bars to check out too. And close to multiple hotels.

name: Anthony Wilson
text: The Chicken Cobb salad was amazing!

name: Chaz PilotWolf
text: Fast service and good food. The nooner is a great option for lunch in a rush.

name: William Morgan
text: Great place before and after the game!

name: megan scott
text: Never been! not bad! packed for the hockey  championship game!

name: Tim Payne
text: Good food and service

name: Kelsie P
text: These are the best wings we have ever had!! Great pizza too!

name: Drew Dickmann
text: Lunch time service was fast and the food was good

name: Kevin Chase
text: Delicious pizza. Happy hour until 7

name: abie vang
text: Pasta was great! The environment is very welcoming as well. The staff is great!

name: Susy Pifher
text: My first time visiting this restaurant.  The food and service we're both excellent.

name: Dean Allemang
text: Simple joint with a nice menu and good food.   Nothing special, but a good, every day place.

name: Joshua Woods
text: Decent regular food but good pizza and cozy atmosphere.

name: CHERI'E WHITE
text: WE GOT PIZZA FROM THERE Mmmmm Soooo GOOD

name: Jeff Nield
text: Always good food and service.

name: Tammy Beck
text: They knew the credit card machine wasn't working when we came in but failed to tell us when we ordered and all I had was my credit card and the waitress got snippy when I had no cash.. Won't be coming back here

name: LOUIS DUMAY
text: The place was clean and the food served on time

name: Chuck Fea
text: Great food great staff....a lil pricey

name: Tasha Smith
text: Great service and food

name: Josh Talbert
text: Good pizza reasonable prices

name: Stephanie Willis.
text: Enjoyed before concert nibbles

name: Shanel Anderson
text: Great place to cath the CBJ!

name: Holly Haberkamp
text: Food delicious. Wish there was one in Toledo OH

name: Marty Crawford
text: Good pizza..ask for Maddie! She took great care of us!

name: cris cas
text: I ordered broccoli and a side of green beans. My broccoli was cold. Not cool. Cold.

name: B Sally
text: Every time I eat here, I feel lousy afterward.  Somehow no matter what I select from the menu.  It seems to be a place that people either love or hate.   I have decided this is my last visit.

name: Don Hayes
text: Friendly wait staff, good food

name: Bill Vinson
text: The waiter had no clue how to answer our simple menu questions. The food was horrible for all three of us at our table. This is definitely not a repeat.

name: Kidd Kato
text: Excellent food, fun and friendly staff highly recommended

name: Shanker Dutt
text: Good place to get quick lunch downtown. Funny thing is you pay more for the same pizza indy size compared to what they called nooner which is same indy size pizza with either frys or salad.

name: Jarrett Shafer
text: Great spot to be prior to a blue jackets hockey game. Great draft selection and the food is superb. I would highly recorded the pizza if you're with a large group!

name: Megan Orlando
text: Drinks are priced right, and though the cost of food is a little high, it's well worth it. Pepper & sausage pizza and the wings were so good, we had it twice in one week! If you're around for anything at the GCCC, definitely check this place out.

name: Brock Liden
text: New wings are good. New ribs were fatty and disappointing

name: Stacy B
text: Great food. Fast service

name: Troy Carlson
text: Boston's is quite good. Not great, but their $8.99 "Nooner" deal (an 8" pizza and side salad)  is definitely worth the money when in the mood for a quick pizza lunch. I'm especially fond of their barbeque chicken pizza!

name: Christopher LaVelle
text: Boston's is an integral part of any trip to Huntington Park. Swinging by and grabbing a tall draft of beer is always a great way to kick-off a Clippers game.

name: Nick Vitali
text: Good beer, okay food, solid service. Great place to watch a game and have some bar food.

name: Teresa Parsley
text: awesome food, great service

name: Alicia LG
text: I've never dined in but I've had food from here that was catered to my job. Not really that good to me I had the wings and I wasn't impressed. It seems to be a little overpriced for a sports bar restaurant.

name: Trina Molnar
text: Fun place and easy access to the hockey arena.

name: Cassandra Davis
text: Love the food and the environment!!

name: Daniel B
text: It's pretty decent, nothing super fancy. I get the soup and salad lunch. Dressing on the side and the better of the two soups and you can get out of here without blowing your diet completely.

name: Frank Green
text: Excellent food. Great atmosphere.

name: bacon burger
text: Great bar food and a nice venue to watch a game.

name: Beverly Crecy
text: The food was oh so good. Great pizza and great pasta dishes!

name: Brian_57
text: Great food,service & drink!!!!

name: Daryl Kulak
text: I love this Canadian pizza chain. Sicilian pizza is great.

name: Ryan Wagner
text: Big variety of food for any mood

name: M8ee
text: Food, wait, price, atmosphere. They were all good. Would go back again and again

name: Liz Cohenour
text: Super busy on game days. Good food and service usually, though. They normally have food options on draft.

name: Matt Seebacher
text: Great place to go before a game at nationwide. Does get very busy on game days though so recommend going early.

name: Mary Williams
text: My initial visit to Boston's for lunch was a letdown. My friend picked the restaurant as she had been there before and liked the food. I had the lunch lasagne which was only mediocre. The freezer burnt breadstick that came with the pasta ‚Ä¶More

name: Josh Anderson
text: Good pizza, nice staff, and accommodating when a larger group shows up with no warning.  Last visit was with about 15 people, 6 different checks, and the staff didn't bat an eye.

name: Matthew Bailey
text: Good atmosphere during hockey games. Thought the pizza resembled the frozen stuff you find at Kroger's though. Good spot to grab a beer pre/post game though.

name: dbcanup
text: Great food and drinks and in the arena district!

name: Seth Hohman
text: Food is pretty low end frozen stuff. Don't expect to come here before a Blue Jackets game, the place will be packed wall to wall. Despite this the service was decent, someone came by to check on us regularly, but unless everyone at my table quickly shouted what they needed our chance at ordering another drink was missed.

name: Ray Cathode
text: Not bad for a chain. Nice location, comfortable seating and environment... good layout and food options.

name: Richard Roberts
text: Even though they were busy I was quickly seated. The food didn't take too long to arrive after ordering. The food wasn't bad, but it wasn't anything special either.

name: Stephen Hinkle
text: We were blown away by the number of pages in the menu.  Pizza, salads, pasta, sandwiches, appetizers, and desserts galore.  The food was good, and the service was friendly.  If we lived in Columbus, we would frequent this place.

name: Kat Kealy
text: Really good food and decent service, plus we were able to get seated right after leaving the hockey game so we could watch the rest of the Penn State and Yankees games - we were at a table where both of us could easily see both games, which was great. The bacon wrapped steak skewers & monster cookie were both really good!

At one point  we called her over and she said, "I'll be right back... unless you need something quick" Whaaaaat?! Probably won't be going back.
